subject: Education
title: Growth Mindset: The Power of 'Yet'
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Growth Mindset: The Power of 'Yet'.

hook.text: Tell a child 'you're so smart' and they'll avoid challenges. Tell them 'you worked hard' and they'll embrace them.

buildup.text: Carol Dweck discovered that children who believe intelligence is fixed give up when they fail. Those who believe it

discovery.text: One word transforms mindset: 'yet.' You can't do this... yet. Adding 'yet' turns failure into a temporary state.

twist.text: Growth mindset has been oversimplified in schools. Praising effort without teaching strategy doesn't actually help.

climax.text: The real lesson: beliefs about ability shape behavior. What children believe about learning changes how they learn.

punchline.text: The most powerful word in education has three letters: yet.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between fixed and growth mindsets?
options: Growth mindset believes abilities can be developed through effort
